b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (13:22): http://www.marcozehe.de/2008/05/01/social-bookmarking-feature-added-to-blog/ terrifies me.  people with screenreaders have 45 images to skip over with near-identical alt text
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:24): Don't screenreaders have a "skip to next paragraph" key, that would let you avoid all those images easily?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:24): oh, wow. I had hoped the silly craze of putting subscription links like that would be over by now.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:26): all those icons are useless
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:26): I have a bookmarklet for the social bookmarking service I actually use

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:26): When I last used Links (a few days ago), I was looking at a page that happened to have a "skip to content" link at the top before all the navigation menu stuff, but the browser just complained "cannot find #content" when I tried using the link :-(

b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (13:27): as far as I can tell, it's mainly done by people who aren't very popular but who really want to be and think that by including those links they'll becoming more so

8276c305beb1ebf1529fb8592cb24083 (13:28): That happens a lot, when making templates for some backend company who just doesn't care
